main event: An unusual circular object was observed over Boston Harbor in May 1956.
interesting points: The object was reported to be about 40-50 feet in diameter and silver in color., The observer noted the object was moving slowly at an altitude of approximately 1500 feet., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes before the object disappeared from view., There was a lack of sound or visible trail from the object., The investigator classified the case as UNIDENTIFIED, noting characteristics that do not match known aircraft.
sighted object: circular silver object in the sky
witness description: an observer working for an engineering firm in downtown Boston
